protocolSections.title: Introduction
protocolSections.body:
This training content is designed for offline learning by non-specialists.

It does not replace clinical judgment. Use it alongside local guidelines and supervision.

protocolSections.title: Initial assessment
protocolSections.body: Assess oxygenation, ventilation, and hemodynamics. Confirm airway patency and device positioning before making changes.

protocolSections.title: Monitoring and follow-up
protocolSections.body: After any change, recheck SpO2, respiratory rate, and clinical signs. Document settings and response. Escalate if goals are not met.

glossary.definition: Positive end-expiratory pressure. Maintains lung volume at end expiration.
Fraction of inspired oxygen. The concentration of oxygen delivered.
Oxygen saturation measured by pulse oximetry.

faqs.question: Is this usable offline?
faqs.answer: Yes. The content is bundled locally and can be searched without network access.

faqs.question: Can I use this for direct patient care?
faqs.answer: This is training and reference material. It does not replace clinical protocols or specialist advice.
